project.name: Java
project.description: The Java Project handles all Gentoo-related Java things.

longdescription.p: The Java herd maintain most packages related to Java development in the Portage tree, which at the present time of writing encompass well over 300 different packages.

Highlights include the Apache Java Projects, JDK/JREs from Blackdown, Sun, IBM, Compaq, BEA, and of course Kaffe. We also package some alternative languages for the JVM, such as Groovy, Scala, JRuby, and Jython. We package IDEs such as Eclipse, and NetBeans. And of course, there is a wide variety of different and popular Java libraries.

dev.description: Everything that has to do with beans

body.p: Due to severe attrition this past year, we now just barely have enough manpower to maintain our 300+ packages. This leaves hardly any leftover time and energy to extend our offering into new areas, such as natively compiled Java packages using gcj, extensively packaging popular Eclipse plugins, or creation of a stable and complete J2EE development platform.

If you have any interest in helping, consider these options:
Helping us to squash bugs
Reporting any bugs you find.
Joining our gentoo-java mailing list and asking/answering questions
Joining our #gentoo-java channel on irc.freenode.org
Helping us write documentation
Spreading the word about Gentoo as a Java development platform
Improving any existing ebuild

Our development of new and exciting stuff is done in the experimental Java subversion repository. You can find it at https://svn.gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/. If you would like to make a checkout of one of these projects, you will, of course, have to emerge subversion.

The purpose of this experimental overlay is to server as a sandbox for exciting new packages which aren't quite ready for prime-time. At the moment of writing it contains mostly modularized JBoss packages, the Spring Framework , and Maven built from source.

pre.caption: Steps for checking out the experimental overlay

body.pre: # mkdir -p /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental # svn co https://gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/gentoo-java-experimental /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental Edit /etc/make.conf and add /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental to PORTDIR_OVERLAY, i.e. PORTDIR_OVERLAY="${PORTDIR_OVERLAY} /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental" Periodically, you should update the overlay # cd /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental # svn update
body.p: Then you should be all set to emerge packages from the experimental tree.
Some major changes are needed to get Java 1.5 unmasked, and axxo has been working on this in his overlay.

The most significant changes include:
Merge-time VM switching (#86900)
Merge-time build.xml rewriting (#86903)
axxo's branch of the java-config-ng started by compnerd
Uses symlinks instead of PATH hacks to choose between user/system VM, which is more flexible.
Removal of jikes useflag, so you can now easily choose between javac, eclipse-ecj, or jikes
A full list of bugs that this overlay addresses can be found here. However, there is still some work that needs to be done. The most up-to-date TODO list can be found here
body.warn: Do not use this overlay with any of the other Java overlays!

pre.caption: Steps for checking out the 1.5 overlay

body.pre:
# mkdir -p /usr/local/overlays/java-experimental # svn co https://gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/axxo-overlay /usr/local/overlays/axxo-overlay Edit /etc/make.conf and add /usr/local/overlays/axxo-overlay to PORTDIR_OVERLAY, i.e. PORTDIR_OVERLAY="${PORTDIR_OVERLAY} /usr/local/overlays/axxo-overlay"
The overlay needs a very recent version of portage, and a new version of java-config # emerge java-config
You will need to re-emerge all your installed JDK's and JRE's. You will also need to re-merge jikes and eclipse-ecj, if you have those installed
You should also re-merge all currently emerged Java packages. This is important because the packages now keep track of additional metadata. An automated script for taking care of this is in the works!
body.p:
The documentation has also been updated for the usage of this new overlay:
Developer Guide
User Guide
axxo and nichoj would really appreciate any comments/suggestions/fixes/patches to improve any of these

One of our users, Chewi, made huge changes to the eclipse eclass. We are now able to build most of the Eclipse plugins which are only in portage as binary packages from source, instead of relying on binary packages. chewi-overlay. He also has a README explaining the changes.
body.note: Some of the plugins in this overlay require packages only found in the experimental overlay!

pre.caption: Steps for checking out the Eclipse plugin overlay

body.pre: # mkdir -p /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay # svn co https://gentooexperimental.org/svn/java/chewi-overlay /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay Edit /etc/make.conf and add /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay to PORTDIR_OVERLAY, i.e. PORTDIR_OVERLAY="${PORTDIR_OVERLAY} /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay" Periodically, you should update the overlay # cd /usr/local/overlays/chewi-overlay # svn update

body.p: Compnerd started java-config-ng as an attempt to improve the current java-config. Yet again, it can found in the svn repository, here.
axxo started a branch to add functionality to support things needed for the 1.5 overlay and generally make things work. It can be found here.
